article.headline: Seton Hall 75, Georgetown 48
article.story: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) -- Andre Barrett scored 25 points in his final home game and Seton Hall held Georgetown to three field goals and 14 points in the first half in posting a 75-48 victory on Saturday night. John Allen added 14 points and Donald Copeland had a career-high 12 as the Pirates (19-7, 9-5 Big East) won their third straight and sent Georgetown (13-12, 4-10) to its sixth straight loss and 12th in 15 games. Brandon Bowman had 20 points and 11 rebounds for the Hoyas, whose 48 points and .265 shooting percentage were season lows. The 27-point loss was their largest of the season. Bowman hit all three of Georgetown's field goals in the opening 20 minutes. He was 3-for-8 from the field in the half and the rest of the team was 0-for-14. Gerald Riley, the Hoyas' leading scorer with an 18.2 point average, finished with 8 points on 0-for-11 shooting from the field.
